METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: "Reakcionarna suha veja na živem narodovem telesu..." (Boris Kidrič)
Rdeča legenda o kolaboraciji
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: »A Reactionary Dry Branch on the Living Body of Our Nation ...« (Boris Kidrič)
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Griesser-Pečar, Tamara
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: V Sloveniji so si komunisti po drugi svetovni vojni oblast zagotovili tako, da so večplastni osvobodilni boj proti okupatorju izkoristili za svoje načrte o prevzemu oblasti, ga izkrivili in izrabili zase. Uspelo jim ga je izenačiti s komunističnim odporom in predstavnike nekomunističnih tokov izločiti kot »kolaboracioniste«. Ta falzifikat je učinkovit še danes - tudi kot posledica ideološko pobarvanih učbenikov. Začeli so ga graditi 16.9.1941, ko je Vrhovni plenum OF monopoliziral odpor in sprejet t. i. »zaščitni odlok«. Prispevek bo prikazal nastanek in razvoj tega falzifikata, ki je imel za posledico številne zločine, tudi povojne množične pomore, izločitev vsake opozicije v deželi, zapiranje in sojenje nasprotnikov, proticerkveno naravnane prisilne ukrepe, izselitve itd.

At the end of the Second World War, communists in Slovenia seized power by manipulating, adjusting, and distorting the multi-layered national liberation war to correspond to their own plans. A resuit of their successful manipulation was that the war for the liberation of Yugoslavia and Slovenia was perceived as communist resistance and all non-communists branded as »collaborators.« Largely due to ideologically distorted textbooks for history this falsification is still in effect. It was b om on September 16, 1941, when the Liberation Front Supreme Plenum passed the so-called protective decree and monopolized the resistance. The paper will examine the origin and the development of this falsification that resulted in numerous crimes, mass executions after the war, elimination of any opposition, imprisonment and trial of politicai opponents, forced measures against representatives and supporters of the Catholic Church, deportations, etc.

At the end of the Second World War, communists in Slovenia seized power by manipulating, adjusting, and distorting the multi-layered national liberation war to correspond to their own plans.
